intro: Erodium cedrorum subsp. cedrorum, commonly known as the narrowleaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, with a distinctive hairy texture. The species is often found in coastal and inland areas, thriving in regions with mild, temperate climates.
